description: A 4f orbital with a highly distinctive configuration, featuring complex lobed structures. Its magnetic quantum number, m_l = 3, dictates a unique spatial orientation and electron distribution pattern.
orientation: distinctive spatial orientation, emphasizing the directional electron probability

nodes.orientation: precisely oriented planes intersecting the nucleus
nodes.description: Planar nodes divide the orbital into complex lobes, reflecting the specific influence of the m_l = 3 magnetic quantum number.
Radial nodes demarcate regions with zero electron probability, underlining the 4f orbital's unique radial features.
